DOC.HEAD: $adv 25
For Release Monday Dec. 25
Forbes List of the 50 Most Profitable U.S. Firms of the '80s ^With BC-Forbes Most Profitable
DOC.TEXT: Here is Forbes magazine's list of the 50 most profitable American firms of the 1980s. The list includes, rank, company name, 10-year average return on equity, latest 12-month return on equity and headquarters city. Return on equity expresses profitability as a percentage of the company's net worth. 1, Liz Claiborne, 51.8, 32.8, New York. 2, Rollins, 47.2, 37.8, Atlanta. 3, Price Co., 40.5, 24.3, San Diego. 4, Limited, 39.9, 33.0, Columbus, Ohio. 5, Commerce Clearing, 39.7, 18.9, Riverwoods, Ill. 6, Kellogg, 38.9, 31.6, Battle Creek, Mich. 7, General Motors EDS, 37.9, 30.1, Dallas. 8, Highland Superstores, 37.3, -4.3, Taylor, Mich. 9, Student Loan, 37.1, 37.7, Washington. 10, Apple Computer, 36.6, 43.2, Cupertino, Calif. 11, Wal-Mart Stores, 35.5, 32.3, Bentonville, Ark. 12, CBS, 35.4, 11.1, New York. 13, Pic'N'Save, 35.2, 20.9, Los Angeles. 14, American Home Products, 35.0, 33.7, New York. 15, Marsh & McLennan Cos., 34.8, 38.3, New York. 16, PSI Holdings, 34.7, 21.2, Plainfield, Ind. 17, Corroon & Black, 34.6, 17.2, New York. 18, Consolidated Stores, 33.7, 7.8, Columbus, Ohio. 19, Geico, 33.6, 22.7, Washington. 20, Ralston Purina, 33.6, 40.3, St. Louis. 21, Bandag, 33.0, 46.9, Muscatine, Iowa. 22, Holly Corp., 32.9, 67.2, Dallas. 23, Jostens, 32.6, 26.5, Minneapolis. 24, Washington Post, 32.4, 21.2, Washington. 25, UST Inc., 32.4, 38.6, Greenwich, Conn. 26, Best Buy Co., 32.1, 1.0, Minneapolis. 27, Deluxe, 32.1, 26.3, St. Paul, Minn. 28, Syntex, 31.2, 47.9, Palo Alto, Calif. 29, Dun & Bradstreet, 31.0, 27.4, New York. 30, Food Lion, 30.8, 29.9, Salisbury, N.C. 31, Merck, 30.8, 50.3, Rahway. N.J. 32, Circuit City Stores, 30.6, 25.8, Richmond, Va. 33, Lockheed, 30.4, 8.3, Calabasas, Calif. 34, Abbott Lboratories, 30.4, 33.8, Abbott Park, Ill. 35, Marion Laboratories, 30.0, 15.1, Kansas City. 36, Progressive, 29.9, 25.3, Cleveland. 37, Nike, 29.8, 37.8, Beaverton, Ore. 38, Dow Jones, 29.7, 27.6, New York. 39, 20th Century Industries, 29.5, 34.9, Woodland Hills, Calif. 40, Oshkosh Truck, 29.2, 11.0, Oshkosh, Wis. 41, Tambrands, 29.1, 21.4, Lake Success, N.Y. 42, Mark IV Industries, 29.0, 21.8, West Amherst, N.Y. 43, Cray Research, 28.9, 17.5, Minneapolis. 44, Kelly Services, 28.9, 29.9, Troy, Mich. 45, Charming Shoppes, 28.8, 19.2, Bensalem, Pa. 46, Philip Morris Cos., 28.4, 31.6, New York. 47, Columbia S&L Association, 28.4, -44.8, Beverly Hills, Calif. 48, Tyson Foods, 27.8, 29.0, Springdale, Ark. 49, Blair, 27.6, 29.7, Warren, Pa. 50, General Cinema, 27.5, 158.7, Chestnut Hill, Mass.
